intro: Psidium maranhense, commonly known as the Maranhão guava, is a tropical plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically yellow or red when ripe. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Its leaves are evergreen, glossy, and have a distinctive aromatic scent.
